metadata: (info { (description "10-Ring is a board game played in Bronze Age Crete, also known as 10/2-Ring, though its original name is not known. Only the layout of the board is known, which takes the form of ten depressions laid out in a circle, divided in half by a line. The depressions are usually made on stone pavements.") (aliases {"10/2-Ring"}) (rules "Ten depressions in a circle, divided in half.") (source "DLP evidence.") (id "1367") (version "1.3.14") (classification "board/race/reconstruction/pending") (credit "Eric Piette") (origin "This game was played in Crete, from around 1900BCE to 1600.") } ) (graphics { (show Edges Hidden) (show Line { {9 0} }) })
